io.github.tomaso2468.rpgonline

Class TextureMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.tomaso2468.rpgonline.TextureMap

  • public class TextureMap
extends java.lang.Object

    A class for storing, managing and mapping textures.

    Textures are loaded using the filter method described by RPGConfig.getFilterMode()

    Textures can be stored in 2 ways: by a string id or by index. When a texture is added it is automatically put into a map with a key based on its string ID and placed into a list at the next available index. The string IDs are automatically interned to reduce overhead. A string ID should be unique as using the same string ID will replace the texture in the map but will not remove it from the fast access list. If the same image is added with different string IDs it will be added mapped to both IDs but will have the same texture ID. It is better to use texture indexes as the performance is slightly higher due to the speed of array indexing as opposed to map lookup.

    Textures can also be added in a way that indicates that they should be mapped into a larger image (texture atlasing). This moves a texture into the same sprite map. A mapped texture cannot be used until generateAllMaps() has been called. Once a texture has been added to a map it will be added normally but will also be mapped to a map of sprite sheets. If texture mapping is disabled then textures are loaded normally. However, to make texture mapping more reliable, mapped textures are loaded first using Java2D and BufferedImage stored in a temporary file then loaded with slick2d. If mapping is disabled textures are still loaded with Java2D stored in a temporary file and then loaded with slick2D but one file is needed per texture rather than per map. This is not needed if textures are directly loaded from a URL. Mapping is controlled with RPGConfig.isMapped(). The size of the sprite atlases are defined by RPGConfig.getAutoSpriteMapSize() but will not exceed the maximum texture size of the graphics card.

    Sprite maps can also be loaded with this class and follow the pattern texture.index (with indexes starting at 0). They can also be mapped.

    Author:
    Tomaso2468

                                     java.net.URL loc)

        This method will automatically delegate to loadTexture() if texture mapping is disabled.

        Parameters:
        s - The texture ID.
        loc - The location of the texture file.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - If an error occurs loading a texture.

                                    java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
                             throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

        Adds a texture to the to-map list.

        This method has some IO overhead if texture mapping is disabled.

        Parameters:
        s - The texture ID.
        img - The image to map.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - If an error occurs adding the texture.

      • addSpriteMap

        public static void addSpriteMap(java.lang.String s,
                                org.newdawn.slick.Image img,
                                int tw,
                                int th)

        Adds an image as a sprite map.

        The textures are bounds as s + "." + i where i is the index in the sprite map starting at the top left corner and travelling horizontally.

        Parameters:
        s - The prefix of the texture ID to bind to.
        img - The image holding the sprite map.
        tw - The width of one sprite.
        th - The height of one sprite.

      • loadSpriteMap

        public static void loadSpriteMap(java.lang.String s,
                                 java.net.URL loc,
                                 int tw,
                                 int th)
                          throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

        Loads a texture then adds it as a sprite map.

        The textures are bounds as s + "." + i where i is the index in the sprite map starting at the top left corner and travelling horizontally.

        Parameters:
        s - The prefix of the texture ID to bind to.
        loc - A URL pointing to a .png image.
        tw - The width of one sprite.
        th - The height of one sprite.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - if an error occurs loading the sprite map.

                                       int tw,
                                       int th)
                                throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

        The textures are bounds as s + "." + i where i is the index in the sprite map starting at the top left corner and travelling horizontally.

        Parameters:

        tw - The width of one sprite.
        th - The height of one sprite.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - if an error occurs loading the sprite map.

      • genTextureMap

        public static void genTextureMap(int sw,
                                 int sh)
                          throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Generates a texture map of the specified size. It is better to use generateAllMaps() as it will automatically load all texture maps. This method will do nothing if mapping is disabled.
        Parameters:
        sw - The sprite width.
        sh - The sprite height.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - If an error occurs mapping textures.

        Parameters:
        x - A number to multiply.
        max - The maximum number to go to (inclusive).
        Returns:
        A multiple of x.
        Throws:
